#!/usr/bin/env python3
from pathlib import Path
import argparse

def bulk_rename(pattern, prefix, dry_run=True):
    """Rename files matching pattern with new prefix."""
    source_dir = Path(".")
    files_to_rename = list(source_dir.glob(pattern))
    
    if not files_to_rename:
        print(f"No files found matching: {pattern}")
        return
    
    print(f"Found {len(files_to_rename)} files to rename\n")
    
    for file in sorted(files_to_rename):
        # Extract number from filename
        parts = file.stem.split("_")
        if len(parts) >= 2:
            number = parts[-1]
            new_name = f"{prefix}{number}{file.suffix}"
            new_path = file.parent / new_name
            
            if dry_run:
                print(f"[DRY RUN] {file.name} -> {new_name}")
            else:
                print(f"Renaming: {file.name} -> {new_name}")
                file.rename(new_path)
    
    if dry_run:
        print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è  This was a DRY RUN. Use --execute to actually rename.")
    else:
        print("\n‚úì Renaming complete!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Bulk rename files")
    parser.add_argument("pattern", help="File pattern to match (e.g., 'IMG_*.jpg')")
    parser.add_argument("prefix", help="New prefix for files")
    parser.add_argument("--execute", action="store_true", help="Actually rename (default is dry run)")
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    bulk_rename(args.pattern, args.prefix, dry_run=not args.execute)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
from pathlib import Path
from datetime import datetime
import shutil

def organize_by_date(source_dir=".", target_dir="organized"):
    """Organize files into YYYY/MM/DD folder structure."""
    source = Path(source_dir)
    target = Path(target_dir)
    
    # Get all files (not directories)
    files = [f for f in source.iterdir() if f.is_file()]
    
    print(f"Organizing {len(files)} files by date...\n")
    
    for file in files:
        # Get file modification time
        mtime = datetime.fromtimestamp(file.stat().st_mtime)
        
        # Create folder structure: YYYY/MM/DD
        date_folder = target / mtime.strftime("%Y/%m/%d")
        date_folder.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
        # Move file
        dest = date_folder / file.name
        print(f"Moving: {file.name} -> {date_folder}/")
        shutil.move(str(file), str(dest))
    
    print("\n‚úì Organization complete!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    organize_by_date()

#!/usr/bin/env python3
from pathlib import Path
import shutil

# Define file type categories
FILE_TYPES = {
    'Images': ['.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.gif', '.bmp', '.svg'],
    'Videos': ['.mp4', '.avi', '.mkv', '.mov', '.wmv'],
    'Documents': ['.pdf', '.doc', '.docx', '.txt', '.odt'],
    'Archives': ['.zip', '.tar', '.gz', '.7z', '.rar'],
    'Code': ['.py', '.js', '.java', '.cpp', '.c', '.sh'],
    'Audio': ['.mp3', '.wav', '.flac', '.aac', '.ogg'],
}

def organize_by_type(source_dir=".", dry_run=False):
    """Organize files into folders by type."""
    source = Path(source_dir)
    
    # Get all files
    files = [f for f in source.iterdir() if f.is_file() and f.name != 'organize_by_type.py']
    
    print(f"Found {len(files)} files to organize\n")
    
    for file in files:
        # Determine category
        category = 'Other'
        for cat, extensions in FILE_TYPES.items():
            if file.suffix.lower() in extensions:
                category = cat
                break
        
        # Create category folder
        target_dir = source / category
        
        if not dry_run:
            target_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
            dest = target_dir / file.name
            print(f"Moving: {file.name} -> {category}/")
            shutil.move(str(file), str(dest))
        else:
            print(f"[DRY RUN] {file.name} -> {category}/")
    
    if dry_run:
        print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è  DRY RUN complete. Remove dry_run=True to execute.")
    else:
        print("\n‚úì Organization complete!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    dry_run = '--dry-run' in sys.argv
    organize_by_type(dry_run=dry_run)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
from pathlib import Path
import re

def clean_filename(filename):
    """Clean filename: lowercase, replace spaces with underscores, remove special chars."""
    # Get stem and suffix
    stem = Path(filename).stem
    suffix = Path(filename).suffix
    
    # Convert to lowercase
    clean = stem.lower()
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    clean = re.sub(r'[\s-]+', '_', clean)
    
    # Remove special characters (keep alphanumeric and underscores)
    clean = re.sub(r'[^a-z0-9_]', '', clean)
    
    # Remove multiple underscores
    clean = re.sub(r'_+', '_', clean)
    
    # Remove leading/trailing underscores
    clean = clean.strip('_')
    
    return clean + suffix.lower()

def clean_all_filenames(directory=".", dry_run=True):
    """Clean all filenames in directory."""
    path = Path(directory)
    files = [f for f in path.iterdir() if f.is_file()]
    
    print(f"Processing {len(files)} files...\n")
    
    renamed_count = 0
    for file in files:
        clean_name = clean_filename(file.name)
        
        if clean_name != file.name:
            new_path = file.parent / clean_name
            
            if dry_run:
                print(f"[DRY RUN] {file.name} -> {clean_name}")
            else:
                print(f"Cleaning: {file.name} -> {clean_name}")
                file.rename(new_path)
            
            renamed_count += 1
    
    if renamed_count == 0:
        print("No files need cleaning!")
    elif dry_run:
        print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è  Would rename {renamed_count} files. Use execute=True to apply.")
    else:
        print(f"\n‚úì Cleaned {renamed_count} filenames!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    dry_run = '--execute' not in sys.argv
    clean_all_filenames(dry_run=dry_run)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
from pathlib import Path
import shutil

def find_large_files(directory=".", size_mb=100, move_to="large_files"):
    """Find files larger than size_mb and move them."""
    path = Path(directory)
    threshold_bytes = size_mb * 1024 * 1024
    
    print(f"Finding files larger than {size_mb}MB...\n")
    
    large_files = []
    for file in path.rglob('*'):
        if file.is_file():
            size = file.stat().st_size
            if size > threshold_bytes:
                size_mb_actual = size / (1024 * 1024)
                large_files.append((file, size_mb_actual))
    
    if not large_files:
        print(f"No files larger than {size_mb}MB found.")
        return
    
    print(f"Found {len(large_files)} large files:\n")
    
    # Sort by size (largest first)
    large_files.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
    
    target = Path(move_to)
    target.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
    
    for file, size in large_files:
        print(f"{file.name}: {size:.2f}MB")
        dest = target / file.name
        shutil.move(str(file), str(dest))
    
    print(f"\n‚úì Moved {len(large_files)} files to {move_to}/")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    find_large_files(size_mb=100)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
from pathlib import Path

def change_extensions(old_ext, new_ext, directory="."):
    """Change file extensions from old_ext to new_ext."""
    path = Path(directory)
    
    # Ensure extensions start with dot
    if not old_ext.startswith('.'):
        old_ext = '.' + old_ext
    if not new_ext.startswith('.'):
        new_ext = '.' + new_ext
    
    pattern = f"*{old_ext}"
    files = list(path.glob(pattern))
    
    if not files:
        print(f"No {old_ext} files found.")
        return
    
    print(f"Changing {len(files)} files from {old_ext} to {new_ext}\n")
    
    for file in files:
        new_name = file.stem + new_ext
        new_path = file.parent / new_name
        print(f"{file.name} -> {new_name}")
        file.rename(new_path)
    
    print(f"\n‚úì Changed {len(files)} extensions!")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    if len(sys.argv) != 3:
        print("Usage: python3 change_extensions.py <old_ext> <new_ext>")
        print("Example: python3 change_extensions.py .jpeg .jpg")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    change_extensions(sys.argv[1], sys.argv[2])
